Name: Leandro Carneiro
Sumário:
Sócio-fundador e Diretor Comercial da Milhão Ingredients. Quando criamos a Milhão, em 2001, tínhamos em mente de que ela não seria apenas uma indústria de ingredientes de milho. Fizemos escolhas primordiais durante nossa trajetória e optamos pela saudabilidade, apostando na produção de ingredientes de milho livres de transgênicos (GMO FREE).

Durante esses anos nossa empresa cresceu, evoluiu e se tornou uma das maiores fornecedoras de ingredientes saudáveis e livres de transgênicos do Brasil e do mundo. Hoje, à frente da Diretoria Comercial da Milhão, priorizo por soluções inovadoras para os nossos clientes, pensando sempre na saudabilidade e qualidade que chegará até a mesa de milhares de famílias.
Ocupação: Fundador & Diretor Comercial
Empresas:
Nome: Milhão Ingredients 
Localização: Goiânia e Região, Brasil 
Descrição: A Milhão é uma das 500 maiores empresas do país e a 4ª maior na categoria Grãos. Especializada no beneficiamento e industrialização de derivados do milho, tem seus produtos distribuídos para todo o Brasil e exportados para mais de 37 países.

Movida pelo compromisso GMO Free, qualidade e segurança, todo o processo produtivo é cuidadosamente monitorado, desde a seleção de sementes ao plantio do milho e a rigorosa seleção dos grãos, até os processos de limpeza e testes de qualidade, atestados por nossas certificações reconhecidas internacionalmente - FSSC 22000, Halal, Kosher, WGC (Integral) - Além de nossa assinatura, o selo GMO Free, que garante produtos 100% livres de transgênicos.

Com 15 anos de atuação no mercado nacional e internacional, a Milhão tem entre seus clientes  algumas das principais indústrias alimentícias do mundo, que dividem conosco o comprimisso com a qualidade e segurança alimentar.

www.milhao.net

Especializações
Food ingredients, Agricultural, Commodity trading and processing, Corn specialized e Corn 
Tempo de trabalho: 2002/2002 
Nível: Fundador & Diretor Comercial

Sumário:
🎓 Graduação em Direito - previsão de conclusão em 2026.

🎓 Graduação em Administração de Empresas - concluído em 2006.

👩‍💼 Profissional com sólidas experiências na Gestão de Negócios, atuando há mais de 17 anos frente aos processos e rotinas administrativas, fiscais, comerciais, contábeis, jurídicas e técnicas em empresas dos segmentos de Curtume, Graxaria e Calçados, com planejamento estratégico de negócios, elaboração de estudos de mercado e identificação de oportunidades, gestão de equipes e de recursos gerais.

💼 Estruturação de departamentos e implantação de políticas e processos, realização de revisões tributárias, gestão de contratos, realização de importação e exportação e processos de R&S.

🏆 Expertise nos processos de ponta a ponta na empresa, com mapeamento e análise de processos, desenvolvimento e implantação de soluções com foco em produtividade, eficiência e custos.

✍ Capacidade de produzir e relatar dados da Gestão Administrativa, Comercial e Financeira com precisão e comunicar-se de forma eficaz com a Presidência, a fim de facilitar uma tomada de decisão ideal.

✈ Realização de viagens profissionais para Itália, Hong Kong, Xangai e pelo Brasil, entre 2016 e 2020, participando de feiras internacionais e realizando visitas comerciais e técnicas em clientes.

📱 (51) 99282-7233
📧 scheilaparode@icloud.com

- Atuação na Direção de todo setor comercial do Grupo, abrangendo mercado Nacional e Internacional de segmentos diversificados: Couro: linha de estofamento moveleiro, estofamento automotivo, calçado, material de segurança, tapeçaria e demais artefatos e artigos de couro; Óleos animais e vegetais: Indústrias de Biodiesel, saboaria, farmacêutica, indústrias de produtos químicos; Farinhas para alimentação Animal; Calçados e Turismo. 
•	Acompanhamento de toda produção com gestão de metas, custos e processos, interface direta com o Presidente na elaboração de estratégias e definições nos desdobramentos das empresas do grupo.

🏆 Estruturação do departamento de vendas com aumento de vendas em 20%, implantação de relatórios gerencias de resultados, elaboração de estudos de mercado, viabilidade e planejamento financeiro.

🏆 Redução a zero dos custos de horas extras, representando 18% da folha (R$ 120 mil/mês, sem reduzir a produtividade.
🏆 Êxito em diversos processos judiciais tributários, êxito no processo de venda de ICMS da empresa, resultando em R$45 MM de retorno ao caixa.
🏆 Migração da energia para o Mercado Livre com retorno de aproximadamente R$900 mil em 3 anos.
🏆 Ganho de processo tributário com dedução da ICMS, resultando em benefício fiscal de R$2,8 MM para uma das empresas do Grupo, ainda tendo outros em faze judicial.

Name: Andre Maurino
Sumário:
André Maurino é Presidente no Brasil da Jacobs Douwe Egberts (JDE), empresa global de cafés e chás com sede na Holanda, que traz em seu portfólio local marcas renomadas de café como L’OR, Do Ponto e Pilão.

Possui mais de 19 anos de experiência profissional como executivo C-Level em diferentes empresas de diferentes setores de negócio, o executivo integrou-se à equipe da JDE em 2012 destacando-se nas posições de Diretor Financeiro e de Diretor Comercial & Vendas. E, desde o início de 2019, ocupa o cargo de Presidente com o desafio de elevar a “premiunização” da categoria de cafés no Brasil.

É graduado em Administração de Empresas e possui MBA pela Fundação Getúlio Vargas, além de especializações realizadas no exterior em instituições como Ohio University, UC Irvine, Babson College e ESCP Europe.

Em sua trajetória profissional, teve passagens também por outras empresas multinacionais de grande porte como Makro Atacadista e Carrefour tanto no Brasil como no exterior.

Name: Fernando Cabral de Mello
Sumário:
In my role as the Chief Executive of Sony Music’s Latin America joint venture with global live entertainment ticket distributor CTS Eventim, I directly lead the full scope of pan-regional business strategy and growth engineering. In just three years, we have grown Eventim Latin America from inception into the region’s #1 player, with a powerful network that has transformed live entertainment in both the e-commerce and retail channels.

Prior to this and throughout my career with Sony Music, I have directed organizations that consistently reshaped the music entertainment landscape. By reinventing the marketing framework, identifying and localizing top talent, and ideating new revenue streams, my teams have delivered record-setting revenue and profit performance in previously untapped markets.

My competencies include Vision Definition • Executive Leadership • General Management • C-Level Business Development • Digital & Traditional Marketing • Go-To-Market Strategy • Organizational Leadership • Strategic Alliances • Joint Ventures • Board Relations • Governance • Talent Management & Development • Spanish & Portuguese Fluency and more…

Sony Music is always seeking the brightest and best talent. If you’d like to explore opportunities, I invite you to visit us at www.sonymusic.com/careers. I also welcome your contact via LinkedIn.
Ocupação:
CEO Eventim Latin America (Sony/Eventim JV) -     
SVP Sony Music Latin Iberia at Sony Music Entertainment
Empresas:
Nome: Sony Music Entertainment 
Localização: Miami, Florida, United States 
Descrição: Sony Music is a global music entertainment company, with several prestigious music labels including Columbia, RCA, Epic, Arista, and others. 

In 2016, I was promoted to define, shape, and lead the launch and growth plan as chief executive and P&L owner of a Latin American joint venture between Sony Music and global live entertainment ticket distributor CTS Eventim AG. In this capacity, I directly manage the full scope of business operations through the executive leadership team, with responsibility for the strategy, brand positioning, capital investments, and C-level business development. Additionally, I hold a dual executive role as SVP of Sony Music Latin Iberia architecting and executing a portfolio of joint ventures and strategic initiatives for Sony. Key achievements:

►Architecting the strategic roadmap for the highly successful launch of Eventim in Brazil. I negotiated the pan-regional joint venture, established the local entity, hired up the organization, localized the company’s platforms, and secured robust content supporting the go-live. Under my leadership we Eventim Latin America from inception into the region’s #1 player with a high-performing network selling more than 10M tickets across e-commerce and retail channels within the first 3 years.

►Negotiating strategic partnerships with the Rio 2016 Olympics, and with LiveNation, the world’s #1 promoter.

►Negotiating stadium tours for Coldplay, Metallica, Foo Fighters, Shakira, BTS, Bon Jovi, Phil Collins amongst others.

►Securing Brazil market brand deals with PayPal, Apple, and Caixa Economica Federal, resulting in strengthened mutual brand equity and the opening of new marketing channels extending to new consumer demographics.

►Positioning Eventim Latin America for long-term ROI growth through the negotiation of strategic partnerships.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2017/2017 
Nível: CEO Eventim Latin America (Sony/Eventim JV) - SVP Sony Music Latin Iberia 

**
Nome: Sony Music Entertainment 
Localização: Miami, Florida, United States 
Descrição: In 2007, I was appointed by the CEO to shape and manage the corporate marketing vision and strategy for a diverse region spanning Latin America, Caribbean, US Hispanic, and Iberian markets, driving the definition and execution of the brand vision, architecture, positioning, and go-to-market strategy for Sony Music’s global portfolio of talent. This included responsibility for traditional and digital campaign prioritization and development, creative concepts, integrated communications, talent scouting, and an organization of 80 employees across the region. Key achievements:

►Achieving consistent growth in revenues, EBIT, and market share via leadership on navigating the business to the next-stage digital evolution across platforms.

►Directing broad market and segmented campaigns driving artist awareness and multiplatform music sales, promoting growth via deals with Adele, Michael Jackson, One Direction, Beyoncé, Shakira, AC/DC, Maroon 5, Justin Timberlake, Santana, and Alicia Keys.

►Identifying and promoting global and local talent, signing and leading album production for Il Volo, Ana Gabriel, Roberto Carlos, Julio Iglesias, and Santana.

►Directing A&R for high-profile projects across the region. For one project, I partnered with Santana on content production, and secured a strategic alliance for a televised HBO concert in partnership with VisitMéxico.

►Helping Adele achieve best-selling status in Latin America.

►Achieving the region’s largest R&B sales certification via the successful launch of Beyoncé’s “I Am… Sasha Fierce.” This pioneered the growth of the regional R&B market, selling 500K+ units in Brazil alone (Diamond Certification).

►Producing profitable new revenue streams via licensing of new catalogs. 


►Developing and promoting several high-performing staff into senior leader roles across the global Marketing organization.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2007/2016 
Nível: Senior Vice President Marketing Latin Region

Name: Fernando Pantozzi
Sumário:
Strong Quality Assurance, Lean, Operations, Supply Chain, and Team Building promoter to comply with the business strategy.

Quality Management and Quality Control process sponsor complying with the ISO, AWS, CWB, and other mandatory regulations. Lead auditor capabilities.

Responsible to promote the Business Risk Assessment discussion with the stakeholders and monitoring the defined goals.

Procurement roles and supplier audit background at Tiers 1 and 2 (quality, regulations, punctuality, etc.) targeting business sustainability.

Customer Service, including sourcing, technical information development, training programs, and Global Hub project implementation

Toyota global supply chain project member and the South American main representative to design the global operation joining with the USA, Thailand, Japan, South Africa and, most of Latin America & Caribbean countries.

Nissan representative at Anfavea (Brazilian Automaker's association) and Inmetro (National Institute of Metrology Standardization and Industrial Quality) to discuss the new ordinances in the Brazilian Congress Committee.
Ocupação: Supply Chain, Operation, Quality & Lean Executive
Empresas:
Nome: Konecranes 
Localização: Houston, Texas e Região, Estados Unidos 
Descrição: Konecranes is the worldwide leader in the lifting equipment industry. The main mission is to improve the Right First Time Process Deliveries acting as a Quality Management System leader going deeply into the Lean Six Sigma concepts application for the Engineered to Order business unit in Houston. 
One of the main roles is leading the stakeholders to catch up immediately with the daily performance disruption. I lead different groups focused on early detection early resolution, risk assessment, and value stream map updates. All decisive to reach out the margin levels earlier than expected.
The actual challenge is keeping it sustainable and improving continuously. For this, the Quality Improvement Teams and Andon have been added to solve the deviations applying the early detection early resolution techniques.
This year I am proposing the implementation of the Sales and Operation Planning methodology to reach out the full process integration.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2018/2018

Nome: Terex Corporation 
Localização: São Paulo Area, Brazil 
Descrição: In charge of Operation, Lean, Planning, Quality System and Supply Chain. Leading 6 direct and 70 indirect with 30 MUSD yearly revenues. 
History started in 2014 in Terex when I was hired to promote supply chain synergy for all lines of products, including manufacturing, imported goods, raw materials, and spare parts. 
The value stream maps, the supply chain process flows had been confirmed and improved with a strong team participation.
In 2016 I joined the Demag (a Terex company) as SR Operations Manager to implement Lean Six Sigma. There I met an amazing team, resulting in gains of 10pp of scrap reduction, +50pp of overall delivery punctuality. 
The game had changed when we had implemented the daily meetings methodology and action plan monitoring to the end-to-end process including the operative and administrative roles.
A new merger happened with Konecranes in the middle of 2017, the main achievement was both brand's projects integration. Had the opportunity to lead the One Team - One Process - One Mission, it was an integration team in a highly collaborative and successful environment resulting in a cheaper production cost to Konecranes and Demag products.

Project manager of Nissan 116 dealers after-sales operation start-up in Brazil within 2 years, including procurement, inventory, warehousing, and distribution for local and imported parts supply. 
ERP (SAP) recovery to adhere to the business plan, supporting over 330% growth within 4 years.
Leading New Parts HUB project ramping up the new operation overlapping the old Warehouse with no parts delivery disruption to the final Customers. 
Brazilian automakers commission leader nominated by the National Automakers Association to negotiate successfully with INMETRO (Brazilian Standardization Institute) reducing the parts homologation costs.
Lead the end-to-end immobilized vehicle special supply route project for local and imported vehicles to avoid the Lemon Law penalties.

Immediately after the implementation, we got the LA and Caribbean Hub responsibilities. That team did a great job! 
After-Sales Supply Chain end-to-end implementation, supporting the Brazilian Dealers networking expansion from 8 to 110 dealer shops within 3 years.  
LATAM Parts administrator training the LATAM Parts Managers to comply with the Toyota parts documentation and technical information management.
Latin America Parts Hub project manager, establishing export flow to 22 countries, leading teams to define the parts procurement, end-to-end inventory levels, transportation method definition, Incoterms, orders method for stock and urgent orders, forecasts, and export regulations for dangerous goods.
Lead the new parts catalog project on the friendly web environment and interactively promoting parts sales increasing and wrong orders mitigation.

Leader of the "milk-run" inbound project analyzing the wasted cargo availability to get consolidating the vehicle line production and after-sales parts getting a huge transport cost saving and increasing the punctuality. 
Leading the bumpers cross-docking project reducing the storage space needs and the overall inventory levels from 3 months to 10 days.
